page.title: 13HARVEST FESTIVAL IN NEWTON.
page.content: The bells pealed joyously to bring us to the evening Harvest Festival this year.It was the first time that these 5 bells had been rung for a service for 40 years.With a keen group of learner ringers it is hoped to peal them more freqently in future.Flowers and harvest produce had been used to decorate the church by the women of the village and the men had given assistance when ladders were needed. The great thanksgiving hymns rolled out from a full village congregation. After the service there was another innovation this year;a harvest supper in one of the village homes with food contributed by several different people.All the harvest produce was sold in aid of a Tanzanian hospital.
